social_posts.post_text:
🌶️ POZOLE ROJO 🌶️ 
This is Mexican comfort food at its finest. The nostalgia and memories from eating Pozole are the best. I will always stand by the fact that my grandma makes the BEST Pozole but I can’t give you a bowl so this recipe will suffice!
It’s so good and easier than you might think. Don’t be intimidated by the dried peppers, its 100% worth it!

Try it out asap as we all experience drops in temps and want nothing more than a big-o bowl of comfort.
Recipe link in bio.

#pozolerojo #pozole #mexicanrecipes #souprecipe #mexicankitchen

TGIF!!! It is freezing out and the only thing I can think about is a cozy soup. This Lasagna Soup is perfect for these cold, winter days. Think of a deconstructed lasagna in a soup version with the yummiest ricotta cheese mixture dollop on top… *chef’s kiss*

Happy Friday!

Recipe link in bio.

#souprecipe #lasagnasoup #soupseason #comfortfoodrecipes

NYE is just around the corner! Need some cocktail inspo?! 
This Blackberry Bourbon Smash is exactly what you need. It is so refreshing and delicious, also it’s pretty so there’s that!
Hope you all have the best end of the year. Thank you all for being here, for your love and support. You guys are the best! I am so excited for this next year full of goods to bring to you all!

Wishing you all the Happiest New Year!! Cheers to 2023 🥂 

Recipe link in bio.

#cocktailrecipes #bourbonrecipes #bourboncocktails #drinks

This Thai Shrimp Curry Soup ALWAYS hits the spot! This cold weather is making me crave all the soups right now.
It is so incredibly flavorful and comforting. So versatile you can use chicken instead and you can sub the zoodles for regular noodles, ramen would be so good!

Recipe link in bio.

Have a fabulous weekend, lovelies!
#souprecipes #thairecipes #comfortfood #soupseason #healthyrecipes #whole30recipes

✨New Recipe!!✨
Mexican Chicken & Lentil Soup
This reminds me of my mom and home. Growing up I honestly didn’t care for this soup but as I grew older I learned to appreciate it and honestly LOVE it now. If you’ve never had lentils, you need to at least give them a try. They’re so hearty and comforting. It’s a legume so it’s similar to beans you may be used to, just tiny. Don’t be intimated by the cooking process, it’s seriously so easy!
Highly recommend you drizzle some spicy salsa on top and serve it with a couple of tortillas on the side.

This soup is so comforting and delicious, exactly what you need these dreary winter days!

Recipe link in bio.

#mexicanrecipes #mexicansoup #lentilsoup #lentilrecipe #lentejas

✨New Recipe!!!
WHIPPED GOAT CHEESE WITH HONEY✨
You guys, this is so dang good! 
It’s creamy, smooth, and you can add any kind of toppings your heart desires. However, honey drizzle is a must! I love to eat this with warm/toasted bread, thin crackers, or veggies as a dip. 
Perfect easy app for a Super Bowl app…GO CHIEFS!!! ❤️💛

Recipe link in bio.

#whippedgoatcheese #goatcheese #superbowlfood #appetizerrecipe #superbowlappetizers

CHILAQUILES ROJOS

Need a brunch idea for the weekend?! These Chilaquiles are exactly what you want im your life! They’re simple but flavorful and so versatile. Do NOT be intimidated by the dried red chiles to make the sauce, I promise it’s easy and worth it. 
Add your favorite toppings like chorizo, queso fresco, cilantro, sour cream, eggs, etc. SO DANG GOOD! Pair it with a mimosa or, better yet, a delicious michelada!

Recipe link in bio.

#mexicanrecipes #chilaquiles #chilaquilesrojos #brunchrecipes

✨Mexican Cauli Rice✨
This recipe is so easy and a great alternative to regular Mexican rice. Isn’t the same thing? No, but it’s so delicious and truly satisfies that Mexican rice need when you are wanting or needing to watch your carb intake. Even if you’re just trying to squeeze in some extra veggies- this is the perfect way to do so!

1 (10oz) pkg frozen cauli rice 
2 tbsp tomato paste or 1/4 cup tomato sauce 
1/2 cup broth
1/4 onion, chopped
1 garlic clove, minced 

Cook rice over medium heat until almost dry, about 15 mins. Add a little oil and add onion and garlic to cook for a couple of minutes. Add in tomato paste (or sauce) and broth, mix. If using cilantro add now. Cook for 10 mins or until liquid is absorbed. 

#mexicanrice #mexicancauliflowerrice #whole30recipes #mexicanrecipes #cauliflowerrice #caulirice

NEW Recipe✨Chicken & Apple Salad with Apple Vinaigrette✨ (Panera salad dupe)
The sweetness of the apples pairs well with the tanginess of the Gorgonzola. You get crunchiness from pecans and some apple chips then wrap it all up with the delicious apple vinaigrette!
Perfect to add some grilled chicken to, tis the season!

Recipe link in bio.

#saladrecipe #grilledchickensalad #springrecipes #cleaneatingrecipe

Tis the season…CARNE ASADA season!
With the holiday weekend here I am sure there will be lots of grilling out and you all want to add this Carne Asada to the mix. So flavorful, easy, and perfect for lots of things like tacos, salads, or on its own with your favorite sides.
Don’t forget to make some salsa, (Verde is the way to go), to eat with this!

Recipe link in bio.

#carneasada #mexicanrecipes #summerrecipes #whole30recipes #whole30 #grillingrecipes

Chili lime shrimp tacos with chipotle ranch slaw, brought to you by @getsidedish Chipotle Ranch!
As I made this recipe I realized Side Dish has a similar recipe on their site so I highly recommend you check that out! I do have a chili lime recipe on my blog if you want to check that out. 
The real star of these tacos is the slaw though!
•shredded purple cabbage
•shredded green cabbage
•shredded carrots 
•cilantro
•lime juice
• @getsidedish Chipotle Ranch

Build the tacos with your favorite tortillas, shrimp, top with the slaw, add some queso fresco, and drizzle some more Chipotle Ranch or your favorite salsa! I also love to use the slaw as my base and make it like a salad and it’s perfection. 

Go get your @sidedish sauce and use DASH10 for 10%off your purchase of any 3-pack! 

getsidedish.com/dash10

#sidedishpartner #chililimeshrimp #shrimptacos  #easyweeknightmeals #tacorecipes

🥭 MANGO SALSA
Happy Fiesta Friday! 💃🏽 
Anyone else feel like summer just flew by?! I am starting to see back-to-school pictures and I can’t even handle it. I still need all the summer goodness in my life so cue this Mango Salsa. It is so fresh and perfect to munch on with chips or to top of your fish tacos, taco bowls, and a lot more. Perfect for last minute pool or lake adventures for sure!

Recipe link in bio.

#mangosalsa #salsarecipe #mangorecipes #whole30recipes #summerrecipes

Hola lovely friends!! Jessica here from @dashof_colorandspice ready for another takeover! I always love spending this week with you all and sharing some delicious recipes, tips, and anything else you need from me during this time.
A little about me: I live in Kansas City with my husband and 2 dogs, currently fostering a 3rd. I am a full time oncology nurse, (I work with cancer patients), and I am also the recipe and content creator of my blog, Dash of Color and Spice. As a Mexican-America woman I am passionate about sharing some traditional Mexican recipes I grew up eating that bring back so many memories. I love creating something we can enjoy by making it Whole30 compatible and still flavorful and delicious!
About my Whole30 journey: I did my first Whole30 in 2018 when I decided I needed to change my dietary ways mostly due to poorly controlled diabetes. I knew what I needed to do, I just wasn’t doing it. After completing my first Whole30 my blood sugars were controlled, I was feeling much better, and my A1C went down! It was amazing to see how much just changing my dietary habits helped with not only controlling my diabetes but also improved my blood pressure, cholesterol, and overall made me feel great!
I’m here to show you this journey doesn’t have to be boring or bland. You can incorporate foods you love and enjoy by modifying it a bit and maybe even adding some spice in your life!
Feel free to reach out at any point with any questions or concerns and find me at @dashof_colorandspice for more recipes, ideas, and conversations!

✨Arroz Con Pollo✨
Jess from @dashof_colorandpsice with the first recipe of the week and one that I grew up eating. Arroz con Pollo is a one-pan meal that is so flavorful and convenient for a weeknight meal. I swap out the regular rice for cauli rice while still keeping authentic flavors. I promise you will love this version too!

Ingredients
1 lb chicken thighs 
1 pkg frozen cauliflower rice (10-12 oz.)
½ onion chopped
2 garlic cloves minced
1 cup frozen mixed vegetables thawed and drained (sub fresh veggies)
½ cup tomato sauce; (sub ¼ cup tomato paste)
½ cup chicken broth
¼ tsp coriander
½ tsp cumin
1 tsp salt divided. Adjust to taste.
¼ tsp black pepper
1 tbsp olive oil

Instructions
Place a skillet over medium heat and add oil.
Season chicken with 1/2 tsp salt, pepper, and cumin.
Once oil is hot add chicken and cook until browned on both sides.
Remove chicken and add onion and garlic.
Cook for a couple of minutes and add cauliflower rice.
Cook until the liquid has evaporated and add veggies, tomato sauce, chicken broth, coriander, and remaining salt. Stir until combined.
Add chicken back in and cover with lid. Cook for about 15 minutes or until all of the liquid has been absorbed.

Please let me know if you give it a try! Don’t forget to come say hi over at @dashof_colorandspice and save this recipe for a delicious Mexican dish to add to your Whole30 journey!

✨Barbacoa de Res✨
Feliz Martes, Happy Tuesday! Jess from @dashof_colorandapice with another recipe to add yo your rotation. Beef Barbacoa, or Barbacoa de Res. It is so versatile and flavorful. This is the instant pot version, and I promise you’re going to want to use it for every meal. Make taco bowl out of it with veggies and add guac and salsa on top. Make a hash with barbacoa, potatoes, veggies, and a fried egg on top. So so good!

BARBACOA
2.5lb chuck roast 
olive oil
1/2 onion
3 garlic cloves
1 tsp oregano
1/4 ground cloves
1/2 cumin
1 bay leaf
1 cup beef broth (can use chicken broth)
1/2 cup chipotle adobo 
1 tsp salt

Chipotle Adobo
1/2 cup tomato sauce
1/2 tsp chipotle chili powder ** this adds a smoky flavor but also some spice. If you don’t want too much spice, try 1/4 tsp
1/2 garlic powder
1/2 tsp onion powder

Cut chuck roast into large chunks 
Turn on instant pot to sauté and add enough olive oil to coat the bottom of the pot.
Add chunks and sear for about 6-8 minutes on each side until browned. 
While beef is browning, make the chipotle adobo by mixing all ingredient together and set aside. 
Add beef broth to pot and scrape off as much browned goodness as you can from the bottom and switch sauté mode off.
Add the rest of the ingredients, stir, and cover. Turn on pressure cook function to high pressure. Make sure valve is closed and set to cook for 35 minutes.

This barbacoa turns out to be so tender with the most delicious flavor that you will LOVE! No blog post yet but I’ll be posting one soon on the blog so make sure you stay tuned over at @dashof_colorandspice !

Potato crusted quiche 
✨Potato-Crusted Quiche: A la Mexicana✨

We made it halfway through the week, friends! Hola, Jess here again from @dash_ofcolorandspice for another recipe to keep on hand that I love for meal prep. 
I like to make this ahead of a work week so I can divide into portions for breakfast or lunch to eat with a simple side salad. 
The best thing with this is you can make it whatever you want: change the veggies, add other veggies, change or add different proteins, etc. 

POTATO CRUSTED QUICHE
(A la Mexicana)
Ingredients: 
2 small russet potatoes 
1tbsp olive oil
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp onion powder
1/2 tsp paprika
1/2 tsp salt, divided 
10 eggs 
1 roma tomato, chopped 
1-2 jalapeños, minced
1/4 large onion, chopped 
1/4 cup cilantro, chopped

Preheat oven to 350.
Slice the potatoes with a mandolin to 1/4 inch thickness. 
In a bowl combine potatoes, olive oil, spices, and 1/4 tsp salt.
Grease a pie dish with some olive oil and arrange the potatoes along the bottom of the dish and around. Bake for about 15 minutes until potatoes start to become tender. 
While the potatoes are baking, whisk the eggs in a mixing bowl until thoroughly whisked.
Cook the veggies in a medium pan over medium heat with some olive oil just until tender, about 10 minutes.
Add in veggies to egg mix and any protein you’d like, I had bacon on hand, and 1/4 tsp salt.
Remove the potatoes from the oven and add in egg mixture. 
Bake for 30-35 minutes until eggs are cooked. You can tell by touching the center to ensure it’s puffy and not “jiggly”.
Enjoy with a small side salad and make sure to drizzle some of that salsa verde we talked about yesterday!
The salsa verde recipe can be found on the blog and check it out at @dashof_colorandspice !

✨IP CARNITAS✨
Hola!! Happy Fiesta Friday, lovelies!
Jess here bringing you a brand new recipe to my Whole30 collection and to @dashof_colorandspice. Carnitas are something I grew up eating so much of. We had it for all kinds of occasions and it was always my grandma making them in a huge cazo or buying them from a carnicería, or Mexican butcher shop, but only on the weekend when they were available. I’ve been wanting to make this recipe for a while but wanted to take my time so I knew it was as simple but delicious as possible!

INGREDIENTS
2.5 lbs pork butt, cut into large chunks
Olive oil
2 oranges, juiced (about 1/2 cup)
2 limes, juiced (about 1/4 cup)
1 tsp oregano
3 garlic cloves
1/2 onion
1/2 tsp cumin 
1 tsp salt 

DIRECTIONS
Set your instant pot to sauté mode and drizzle a layer of olive oil.
Once the pot is hot, add pork chunks and  brown each side for about 7-9 minutes each. 
Add the juices and seasonings.
Switch mode to pressure cook, place on high pressure, secure lid making sure valve is closed, and cook for 20 minutes. 
Once done quick release and shred.
You can leave as is or you can spread it out onto a sheet pan and place under a broiler for just about 3-5 minutes to crisp it up a little. 
The flavor is insane and this would be perfect to make pork chile verde, use in taco bowls, have over a baked potato with veggies and salsa, put on top of roasted veggies. 

Hope you try it out asap and check out my sals recipes over at @dashof_colorandspice for a little more motivation!

✨Pollo en Adobo✨
Feliz Sábado friends! Happy Saturday! Time for another recipe from yours truly, Jess over at @dashof_colorandspice.
This one I’ve been looking forward to because I LOVE sharing recipes that use dried chiles to show you it’s not hard. I love exposing you to different ingredients and flavors. Watch the stories for a breakdown on dried chiles where I give you a little more education 😉.

INGREDIENTS
1 whole chicken (about 3-1/2lbs), spatchcocked 
olive oil 
3 small potatoes, diced 
3 medium carrots, diced 
5 guajillo peppers
2 ancho peppers
4 roma tomatoes
1 onion
3 garlic cloves
1 tsp oregano
1/4 tsp ground cloves
1-1/2tsp salt, divided 
1/4 tsp pepper
2 cups water

INSTRUCTIONS 
Preheat oven to 425.
Place a large pan over medium high heat.
Remove stems from peppers and empty out seeds and veins. You may have to open the peppers up to do so.
Add olive oil to hot pan and add tomatoes, onion, and garlic. Cook on both sides for a few minutes until everything becomes tender. Add in peppers, mix, and add water. Cover pan and cook for about 10 minutes until peppers are soft.
Place everything from the pan into a blender and add in oregano, cloves, pepper, and 1/2 tsp salt. Set that aside for a few minutes to cool down and prepare your chicken. 
You can either spatchcock it at this point, cut it into different pieces, or use whatever kid of chicken cut you’d like. 

…continued in comments.

Provecho! You can find other recipes using dried chiles over at @dashof_colorandspice and don’t be afraid to ask me questions about dried chiles, the recipe, or anything else!

🇲🇽 Mexican Independence Day 🇲🇽 

Happy Mexican Independence Day to all my fellow paisanos!
I am so proud to be a Mexican-American woman and embrace my culture all the time. I am so proud of my parents for leaving their home, their country, everything they knew and loved, to make a better life for themselves and their family. Thanks to them I am who I am and have what I have. Thanks to them I am bilingual and was educated on my culture and was brought up learning to be proud of my heritage. 

It’s also Hispanic Heritage Month, a time to recognize the contributions Hispanic/Latino Americans have made to the United States. So please take the time to learn about that and support local Hispanic/Latino businesses!

Here’s to Mexico, a beautiful country with so much culture, color, diversity, insanely good food, and so much more! Go have a marg to celebrate, go have some good REAL Mexican food, and remember Cinco de Mayo is not Mexican Independence Day 😆.
Salud! 

Are you Hispanic/Latino? If so, what’s your favorite dish?? Something that screams familia. For me it’s Pozole or homemade tortillas and some beans de la olla with queso fresco. 

#mexicanindependenceday #hispanicheritagemonth #mexicanamerican #mexicanamericanwoman

You all NEED these super easy air fryer salmon bites in your life. The true star of this recipe though is the delicious Chipotle Ranch from @getsidedish ! #ad
This sauce makes it super easy for me when I just want to throw something quick together. These salmon bites are perfect to thrown on a bed of lettuce with all kinds of veggies with an extra drizzle of Chipotle Ranch. They’re also great to have with cauli rice, roasted veggies, and (obvs) extra sauce. 
If you’re doing the September Whole30 then you know having good sauces/dips/marinades is game changer. Plug in the Whole30 Side Dish bundle, only available in September. It includes the Creamy Sesame and my fave, the Chipotle Ranch, along with a recipe booklet filled with Whole30 Recipes. Use my code DASH10 for 10% off your first order! Link in bio to place your order ASAP! #sidedishpartner 

CHIPOTLE RANCH SALMON BITES 

1lb salmon, cut into large cubes
1/4 tsp garlic powder
1/4 tsp onion powder
1/2 tap paprika
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 tsp chipotle powder, optional (can try just a dash)
1 tbsp olive oil
@getsidedish Chipotle Ranch 

Preheat air fryer to 350.
In a bowl add salmon, spices, and olive oil.
Add seasoned salmon bites to air fryer basket and cook for 7-10 minutes, depending on crisp preference and air fryer. At 7 minutes they’re cooked through. 
Remove from air fryer and place in a bowls wait for them to cool a little and toss in some Chipotle Ranch, enough to coat all the salmon. Measure this with your heart!
Add and extra drizzle to your finished dish, you’ll want ALL the goodness!

Ok you all, I feel like Lasagna Soup is trending right now (and for good reason!). So I’m throwing it back to my version that you all need to try. It’s so incredibly easy and versatile. I love sneaking in veggies like zucchini and you can choose what ground meat you’d like or even make it a vegetarian version with just veggies. The dollop of cheese mixture on top is a must though so don’t forget that. This is perfect for a chilly day as we get ready to have MANY more of those!

Recipe link in bio.

#lasagnasoup #souprecipes #soupseason #soupseason
